com.characterforming.jrte.base

Class BaseTarget

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.characterforming.jrte.base.BaseTarget
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITarget

    public class BaseTarget
extends java.lang.Object
implements ITarget
    Base ITarget implementation class exports no effectors. It serves only as a public proxy for the core transduction target that provides the built-in effectors. It can be subclassed by specialized targets that implement ITarget to define additional effectors. Specialized targets present their effectors by overriding the bind(ITransduction) method, and these may serve as subclasses for additional extensions. Each subclass override must call super.bind() and include the superclass effectors as predecessors of its own in the returned list. In that context you should consider using a List<IEffector<?>> to accumulate subclass effectors and call List<..>.toArray() to obtain top-level bindings to return.
    Author:
    kb

    • Method Detail

      • bind

        public IEffector<?>[] bind(ITransduction transduction)
        Description copied from interface: ITarget
        Bind a transduction and list all effectors presented by this target. This method is called to list the names and types of the effectors expressed by the target class and to bind the target effectors and effector parameters to the transduction.

        Subclasses must include their effectors in the IEffector array returned. After runtime binding, effectors are invoked when triggered by input transitions.

        Specified by:
        bind in interface ITarget
        Parameters:
        transduction - The Transduction that the target is being bound to
        Returns:
        An array of IEffector instances implemented by the target.
        See Also:
        bind(ITransduction)

      • getTransduction

        public final ITransduction getTransduction()
        Description copied from interface: ITarget
        Get the ITransduction instance that is bound to the target
        Specified by:
        getTransduction in interface ITarget
        Returns:
        The Transduction that is bound to the target, or null if unbound
